meanings.definition: To shine brightly or radiantly outward.
meanings.sent1: The sun was outbeaming through the clouds.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse was outbeaming its light across the sea.
meanings.sent3: The fireflies were outbeaming in the dark night, creating a magical scene.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was outbeaming like a beacon of happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The stars were outbeaming in the clear night sky, twinkling brightly.

meanings.definition: The act of beaming or shining outward.
meanings.sent1: The outbeaming of the flashlight helped us find our way in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The outbeaming of the headlights illuminated the road ahead.
meanings.sent3: The outbeaming of the disco ball added a fun touch to the party.
meanings.sent4: The outbeaming of the sun on the water created a dazzling reflection.
meanings.sent5: The outbeaming of her joy was contagious, spreading smiles to everyone around.
